Verbal test scores and number of library books checked out for 15 eighth graders

Data for Exercise 9.30

Format

A data frame with 15 observations on the following 4 variables.

number

a numeric vector

verbal

a numeric vector

SRES1

a numeric vector

FITS1

a numeric vector

References

Kitchens, L. J. (2003) Basic Statistics and Data Analysis. Duxbury

Examples


str(Verbal)
#> 'data.frame':	15 obs. of  4 variables:
#>  $ number: int  12 15 3 7 10 5 22 9 13 7 ...
#>  $ verbal: int  77 85 48 59 75 41 94 72 80 70 ...
#>  $ SRES1 : num  0.474 0.606 -0.771 -0.485 0.909 ...
#>  $ FITS1 : num  73.9 81.1 52.5 62 69.2 ...
attach(Verbal)
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 3):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 5):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 6):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 8):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 10):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 12):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 15):
#> 
#>     number
#> The following object is masked from Poison (pos = 17):
#> 
#>     number
model <- lm(verbal~number)
summary(model)
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = verbal ~ number)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -16.261  -3.886   3.059   4.751   7.974 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  45.3464     4.0217  11.276 4.39e-08 ***
#> number        2.3828     0.2751   8.662 9.27e-07 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 6.695 on 13 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.8523,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.841 
#> F-statistic: 75.03 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 9.265e-07
#> 
detach(Verbal)
remove(model)
